algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) on the state space of strings, where states are strings and edges are valid swaps.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum swaps to transform one string into another anagram.
problem_summary_technical: Performs BFS on strings, treating each string as a node and swaps as edges, to find the shortest path (minimum swaps) to the target string.
key_insights: This problem can be modeled as finding the shortest path in a graph where nodes are permutations of the string and edges represent a single swap.
Breadth-First Search (BFS) is the appropriate algorithm to find the minimum number of swaps (shortest path).
The state space can be large, but we can optimize by only considering swaps that move characters closer to their target positions in `B`.
